results.title: Hope is not a method (2nd revision)
results.creator_credit: Wexler Film Productions and Planned Parenthood Center of Syracuse
results.brief_description: Cites and describes nine contraceptive methods with anatomically explicit diagrams. States the advantages of withdrawal, rhythm, spermicidal chemicals, the cap, the condom, the diaphragm, the pill, the IUD and sterilization.

results.title: Hope is not a method
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to convey and illustrate the various methods of birth control. Seven types of contraception, in addition to vasectomy and tubal ligation are illustrated by means of animation and live action.

results.title: Hope for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film documents what was, for its time, a revolutionary breakthrough in occupational therapy - the pursuit of simple industrial vocation in sheltered workshops. A range of Victorian sheltered workshops are surveyed, and the filmmakers are keen to promote the greater satisfaction afforded their subjects by work which is both financially rewarding and socially useful.

results.title: Hope and glory
results.brief_description: John Boorman recreates the London and England of his childhood, when he was a young boy living through the excitement of the Blitz, whilst the adults around him were dealing with the horror of war as best they could. In contrast to the adult’s fears, for the children the war also brings adventure and excitement, and much of the film’s comedy comes from the differing perspective’s between the “grown-ups” and the “kiddies”. The recreation of war-time London is visually spot-on. Boorman wrote the screenplay. The film stars Sarah Miles.

results.title: Hope
results.creator_credit: Leslie Jones, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Les Jones heard those two magic words “It’s over”, he starting thinking about his future after the war. The middle of three generations of army men, he was part of the last major action in the Pacific part of World War II. As well as being uncertain about his future, Les also thought about those that wouldn’t be returning with him. It is with the thoughts of these lost soldiers in mind, that Les considers war and whether or not there is a better way to solve conflict.

results.title: Hoop dreams
results.creator_credit: Steve James, Peter Gilbert, Frederick Marx, Kartemquin Films and KTCA-TV (Television station : Saint Paul, Minn.)
results.brief_description: ‘Hoop Dreams’ follows two star basketball players over five years, beginning when they are just fourteen and heading for high school careers that will make or break their dreams of becoming stars in the NBA. Arthur Agee and William Gates emerge as distinct characters, engaging the audience in an almost heartbreaking degree of emotional identification with the hurdles they both have to overcome. Unlike many sports films that climax with the supreme triumph of victory in the big game, this film challenges the definition of what constitutes winning. Winner of the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival in 1994.

results.title: Hook, line and sinker
results.creator_credit: Roy Layzell, Andrew Rice and Esso Film Unit
results.brief_description: A description of the trip made by a new type of line fishing vessel on her maiden voyage to northern waters. Demonstrates the modern equipment of the Scottish-built ship with its refrigeration, line hauling tackle and diesel engine and brings out the skill and efficiency of the crew.
